IncomingSocketManager

public class IncomingSocketManager

The IncomingSocketManager class is in charge of managing all of the incoming sockets. In particular, it is in charge of: 1. On Linux when no special compile options are specified: a. Creating the epoll handle b. Adding new incoming sockets to the epoll descriptor for read events c. Running the thread that does the epoll_wait 2. Creating and managing the IncomingSocketHandlers and IncomingHTTPDataProcessors (one pair per incomng socket) 3. Cleaning up idle sockets, when new incoming sockets arrive.

TODO: this tuning parameter should be revisited as Kitura and libdispatch mature
